gears.sidescroller.util

Class FlyweightMatrix<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gears.sidescroller.util.Matrix<java.lang.Integer>
      • gears.sidescroller.util.FlyweightMatrix<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of value each FlyweightMatrix cell encodes
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sprite, Structure, TileMap

    public class FlyweightMatrix<T>
extends Matrix<java.lang.Integer>
    The FlyweightMatrix class is used to store a 2D array of values while conserving space in memory. It uses the Flyweight design pattern by mapping Integer keys to single instances of each type of Object it can hold. Literally speaking, this is a matrix of integers, but functionally speaking, you can use it as though it were a matrix of T. Important note: the get(x, y) method gets the INTEGER key at the given coordinate, while getValueAt(x, y) returns the VALUE at that point. Additionally, forEachCell(...) passes the INTEGER key, whereas forEachValueInCell(...) passes the VALUE
    See Also:
    TileMap, Level
